title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 November 2012 - XWiki
content: has joined #xwiki 00:09  has quit 00:35  has joined #xwiki 00:37  has quit 02:58  has quit 04:04  has quit 04:08  has joined #xwiki 04:30  has joined #xwiki 05:31  has quit 06:02  has quit 06:04  has joined #xwiki 06:08  has quit 06:33  has joined #xwiki 07:29  has joined #xwiki 07:32  has quit 08:02  has joined #xwiki 08:24  has quit 08:31  has joined #xwiki 08:31  has joined #xwiki 08:34  has quit 08:44  has joined #xwiki 08:56  has joined #xwiki 08:58  mflorea: good morning, fyi I'm working on EditInlineTest.testEditModeCanBeSet 08:59  vmassol: good morning, ci is down for me 08:59  indeed 09:07  has joined #xwiki 09:10  has quit 09:25  has quit 09:25  has joined #xwiki 09:28  tmortagne: you just gave the guy the exact link I gave him earlier ;) 09:29  he's a bit strange, he wants xwiki to do something dynamic but he doesn't want to have to specify it.... 09:29  ok did not see it, lets say he gets a confirmation he should use scripting 09:30  yep 09:30  maybe AWM but not sure, his use case is not clear for me 09:35  has joined #xwiki 09:37  vmassol: for me he want to display some text based on variable informations that's scripting macros even if he does not seems to understand the concept of scripting at all 09:42  tmortagne: is there something that overwrites the log level in extension tests? I committed a TestRule that logs some debugging info and it works fine for ui-tests (I can see the [INFO] logs in the console) but it doesn't for the extension-tests. The rule is executed, because it also takes a screenshot on failure, and I can see the screenshot in the target dir. 09:43  I tried to copy the logback.xml from src/test/resource of ui-tests to extension-tests but no change 09:43  mflorea: it depends which logs, the log you see in EM UI are grabbed to not pollute the log file 09:43  but logs are not disabled ingeneral during the integrations test AFAIK 09:44  they are for ui-tests, because of the custom logback.xml file I guess 09:44  I did not do anything special for logs myself 09:45  My test rule uses the standard logger, and logs with INFO level. In ui-tests I can see in the console my messages 09:47  AFAIK extension-tests is a customized XE, there is nothing really special on test side 09:47  has joined #xwiki 09:47  checking something 09:48  I think I know 09:49  in the pom of ui-test the maven-surefire-plugin is configured to use the custom logback.xml file 09:50  let me do the same in extension-tests 09:50  ok 09:50  I duplicated ui-test when I created extension-tests but I guess this conf is more recent 09:51  probably yes 09:51  has joined #xwiki 09:51  has quit 09:51  has joined #xwiki 09:55  tmortagne1: it works, committing 09:58  mflorea: ok 09:59  has quit 09:59  has joined #xwiki 10:07  has quit 10:07  has joined #xwiki 10:11  has joined #xwiki 10:17  has joined #xwiki 10:17  Hi, is there a way to use a macro for generating a toc for a tree within a space ? 10:27  anyone here at all ? 10:29  Hi zykes- 10:29  has joined #xwiki 10:29  have you checked on extensions.xwiki.org 10:29  ? 10:29  for example: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#|t=extensions&p=1&l=30&s=doc.creationDate&d=desc&summary=tree 10:30  (search for "tree" in the summary column) 10:33  has quit 10:33  has joined #xwiki 10:33  ok! 10:34  is there any guide on setting up caching / nginx or so with xwiki ? 10:34  I want to use nginx to ssl proxy to xwiki 10:34  I think so 10:34  I 10:34  zykes-: you should try google before asking :) 10:34  vmassol: done that 10:35  and got it partially working 10:35  it's teh first link 10:35  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/NginX 10:35  doesn't that mean you would need to host your xwiki at / on tomcat ? 10:36  don't ask me 10:36  I almost don't even know what nginx is :) 10:36  ah, what do you use then vmassol ? 10:37  zykes-: nothing…. or just tomcat or apache/tomcat 10:37  ah 10:37  You don't need to host it at the root if you're using a proxy. You can use mod\_rewrite (I assume nginx accepts apache mods) to add in the /xwiki/ directory so your users don't see it. 10:37  I'm not familiar with nginx but I am with lighttpd. 10:39  All my stuff works currently except that the some links generated by xwiki ends up being http:// instead of https:// 10:40  did you change the xwiki.conf file to output https links? 10:40  err .cfg 10:41  nope, did that now, what's the easiest way to refrseh the app in tomcat? 10:41  http://wiki.nginx.org/NginxHttpRewriteModule <-- looks like they have something comparable 10:41   /path/to/tomcat/bin/catalina restart 10:41  IIRC 10:43  even though I added the https part and restarted it's doing: http://10.4.62.40/xwiki/bin/get/XWiki/AddExtensions?extensionSection=progress&extensionId=asiri%3Aemoticon%2Dmacro&extensionVersion=1.0§ion=XWiki.AddExtensions 10:44  When I click on the Detail / Install button on the "Add Extensions" page 10:45  we need a test for this 10:45  So I just do "Failed to retrieve extension data.Server not responding" 10:45  sorry s/do/get 10:45  how can I fix that cjd ? ;) 10:46  does your proxy set the x-forwarded-host field? 10:46  let me see 10:46  someone else had a proxy which wasn't working properly and it turned out that it was not setting that http header 10:46  tcpdump -i lo 'tcp port 8080' 10:46  tcpdump -A -s0 -i lo 'tcp port 8080' 10:48  http://fpaste.org/D75Q/ < cjd 10:48  seems so 10:49  or, on the first request but not the second :| 10:51  I see X-Forwarded-For but not X-Forwarded-Host 10:51  http://wiki.nginx.org/LikeApache <-- quick google pulls this up 10:51  haha! 10:51  sorry, aha :) 10:52  forwarded-host 10:55  now I get 302 clicking on the Uninstall butto ;p 10:56  it's still trying to do "http://10.4.62.40/xwiki/bin/get/XWiki/AddExtensions?extensionSection=progress&extensionId=asiri%3Aemoticon%2Dmacro&extensionVersion=1.0&xback=%2Fxwiki%2Fbin%2Fadmin%2FXWiki%2FXWikiPreferences%3Feditor%3Dglobaladmin%26section%3DXWiki.AddExtensions§ion=XWiki.AddExtensions" 10:56  hmm 10:56  you can confirm it's setting X-Forwarded-Host ? 10:59  has joined #xwiki 10:59  http://fpaste.org/Zebb/ < pretty sure 11:02  hrm I think X-Forwarded-Host was a problem with subdomains so it's not what's happening now but it was lible to bite you later anyway. 11:04  in xwiki.cfg you set xwiki.url.protocol=https, correct?\ 11:07  has quit 11:13  has joined #xwiki 11:19  vmassol, have you had the time to look at the importdokuwiki problem yet (i sent you the dokuwiki archive on saturday)? 11:22  autoditac: sorry not yet, I'm a bit busy with the 4.3 release ATM 11:23  guys do you also have platform fialing on master? 11:23  I have 23 tests failing on oldcore 11:24  has joined #xwiki 11:25  has quit 11:25  mflorea: just fixed the flicker for EditInlineTet (but in a radical way ;))... 11:26  vmassol: nice 11:26  err missing one commit in the irc logs 11:31  ok the problem building master was my fault 11:31  I had some local changes that were causing the issue 11:33  vmassol, np 11:34  autoditac: I'll try later, keep pinging me if you don't find the answer 11:34  vmassol: I'd bet on your local changes too, I can build oldcore 11:35  yep, thanks 11:37  mflorea: I tried spending the weekend setting up a stub environment for oldcore but I dropped it in the end… I first try to isolate at the storage level but writing a stub for XWikiStoreInterface is too hard with the search methods 11:38  I then tried to work at the database level but using hsqldb in memory (mem) but and trying to reduce the hibernate startup time but it's too slow 11:38  I can cache the mapped classes but the first setup takes 4 seconds 11:38  so I dropped that idea too 11:39  for the new model we'll really need to ensure we can write unit tests for it without a real store 11:41  has joined #xwiki 11:47  "xwiki.url.protocol=https" cjd 11:47  hmm 11:47  this might be a bug 11:47  looking... 11:47  want me to post you my config ? 11:51  mflorea: do you know what's left to fix on the func tests? 11:51  should I start the release? 11:51  vmassol: wait until my thing is checked out ? ;p 11:51  vmassol: I'm waiting for CI to see what tests are left failing. Most of them should be fixed though. 11:53  mflorea: ok so I'll wait 2 hours more 11:53  the remaining ones are flickers so you can go on with the release, and we'll continue to fix them afterwards 11:54  too bad my commits from yesterday evening were not build.. 11:54  (at least the tests were not run) 11:54  indeed 11:57  has quit 12:02  damn, I love XWiki ! 12:02  cjd: did you find any problems ? 12:03  looking for the file where it's defined 12:03  ;p 12:10  zykes-: try pasting {{velodcity}}$xwiki.getURL('Main','WebHome','view'){{/velocity}} in a page 12:11  and tell me if it uses the https properly 12:13  cjd: /xwiki/bin/WebHome/PaaS/Main?view < is all it gives ;p 12:14  you need to call getExternalURL cjd AFAIR 12:14  I'm debugging why zykes- gets the wrong type of link from the extension manager 12:18  has joined #xwiki 12:19  has joined #xwiki 12:21  should I try to use the other method cjd ? 12:21  no, that was for testing 12:22  can you paste the content of the admin page? 12:22  paste it how ? 12:22  view source and copy that to a pastebin 12:23  I have a feeling something's tricking prototype into using http based relitive urls 12:33  http://pastebin.com/E7vdsx0j 12:48  cjd: ? 12:54  has quit 13:13  zykes-: looks like a bug, feel like reporting it on jira.xwiki.org? 13:14  It's strange because the code is doing the right thing.. maybe try with a different web browser just to see if you can narrow it down 13:19  cjd: already tried with firefox and chrome ;p 13:20  has quit 13:42  guys I'm going to start releasing commons 13:46  hmm how does it know what to release? (maven-release.sh) 13:47  ok it asks for a version 13:48  checking how it finds the branch based on that 13:51  ok check\_branch()  does some magic 13:54  has joined #xwiki 13:55  has quit 13:55  is now known as 13:57  jvdrean: could you look at http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-4.3/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/169/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes/ApplicationsPanelEntryTest/testApplicationPanelEntry/ ? 13:58  sburjan: anything you want to raise before I start the release? 13:59  sburjan: friday everything worked ok. Migrations were ok. Let's hope there wasn't a newer commit which broke stuff 13:59  vmassol: 13:59  I don't think so 13:59  then you have the blessings of the QA team to start the release ;) 14:00  ok cool 14:00  will you recommend this version? :) 14:00  yes :) 14:01  cool 14:01  I am really happy about the work it has been done in 4.3, and I'm glad we're releasing blocker free :) 14:01  yep 14:02  has joined #xwiki 14:02  has quit 14:02  has joined #xwiki 14:06  has joined #xwiki 14:08  only thing "missing" are translations (see translation report from silviar) but this arrived a bit late to fix in 4.3. It could be fixed for a 4.3.1 14:08  silviar: is this report ready now? 14:08  if so you might want to send it to the devs list 14:10  has joined #xwiki 14:10  vmassol: Hi! Yes, the report is ready and the translations fixed partially. Mostly the ones for XEM are fixed. We will! Thanks for the suggestion. 14:10  I just happened to see it by chance... 14:11  :) 14:13  Sorin is reviewing each entry this week to see whether translations or keys are missing. Afterwards we'll talk to the devs about the missing keys and to some of the French community members to see if they can help with the translations. :) 14:13  silviar: ok 14:14  sburjan: could you update http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki43#HUpgrades for the tested browsers and databases? 14:16  no mysql? 14:16  no oracle? 14:16  just a sec, I'm otp 14:16  ok 14:18  has joined #xwiki 14:20  same question for browsers sburjan, I've seen manuel reporting issues with IE8/9 so it should be in the list of tested browsers too 14:20  it will vmassol  :) 14:20  it needs to be there before the release 14:20  so it hsould have been there already 14:20  as soon as you've tested it 14:21  I'll add the database section 14:26  sburjan: please fill http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki43#HTestedBrowsers26Databases asap 14:27  I'll fill everything vmassol 14:27  thanks 14:27  and http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki43#HTestReport too 14:27  :) 14:29  has joined #xwiki 14:29  has quit 14:32  ok commons and rendering releases 14:32  mflorea: wdyt for platform? 14:32  thereare 3 tests failing in -ui 14:33  can you confirm that they're not real problems? 14:33  yes, but enteprise stil doesn't include my latest fixes 14:33  really? 14:33  that's strnage 14:33  I checked 14:33  no, it's normal 14:33  vmassol: meeting finished 14:33  updating now 14:33  ok 14:33  mflorea: so should I wait more or start releasing platform? :) 14:52  nah, it comes up with some macro stuff ? 14:53  if you edit it you'll see it contains a single macro 14:53  so guys: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1253 14:53  (an include macro) 14:53  just put whatever you want 14:54  is there a way to edit what it says there ? the stuff it includes that is 14:54  ah yes but that's not the home page 14:54  :) 14:54  just follow the link in the panel on the right when you're editing 14:54  it shows included documents 14:54  FTR we're going to make this easier to understand for newcomers in the coming versions 14:55  ;) 14:55  is the "realtime collaborative edit" stuff in yet ? It's ok :) 15:10  zykes-: wrong jira project 15:10  fixing 15:11  done: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8507 15:11  (you couldn't have know, just telling you for the future in case you need to create other jiras) 15:11  has joined #xwiki 15:14  has quit 15:16  has joined #xwiki 15:16  has quit 15:22  nice UI for the doc mflorea http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/App+Within+Minutes+Application#HFieldPalette :) 15:22  ;) 15:29  has joined #xwiki 15:33  has joined #xwiki 15:46  I think it's the frist time I do a release with so many modules failing to build… not feeling very safe.... 15:48  has quit 15:49  has joined #xwiki 15:49  has quit 15:50  can someone explain to me the PURL creation process since it's not clear from http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HPURL ? 15:50  when I go to http://purl.org/docs/purl.html 15:51  I  "create an advanced purl" 15:51  vmassol: yea purl UI is anything but intuitive 15:51  but there's no field to put the target 15:51  I always used the script to create the purl 15:51  not sure what type of PURL I should choose either 15:51  ah yes you need to choose the type before you get the target 15:52  should I choose a 302? 15:52  Ill check the script 15:52  vmassol: do you have a purl account ? 15:52  yep 15:53  maybe not 15:53  can you add me? 15:53  give me your id and I will add you 15:53  vmassol 15:53  done 15:54  has quit 15:54  has joined #xwiki 15:54  tmortagne: thanks, it's written in the doc not to use the script 15:55  "Currently, the automatic method is not working, so you need to use the manual method described further below." 15:55  vmassol: this doc did not exist last time I did a release 15:55  has joined #xwiki 15:55  maybe Enygma` added it 15:55  part of the script dont work well 15:55  but the purl part is ok 15:57  this purl thing is a bit a pain especially since it's not really necessary 15:58  a tweet is supposd to be temporary anyway 15:58  and using bit.ly or similar is good enough IMO 15:58  (this is what I used to do before) 15:59  tmortagne: I don`t remember the reason. It might be possible that I`ve added that note, but I am sure that on all the realeases that I did, I used the manual method. 15:59  I think that when I ran the automatic method nothing happened 15:59  but I don`t remember details 15:59  if it`s no longer valid, please remove it 15:59  Enygma`: it was probably because most of it was commented by last release manager that's all 15:59  has quit 16:00  tmortagne: well, it was probably my first release 16:00  that's the way we used to "select" was to do in this script 16:00  s/was/what/ 16:00  vmassol: the purl part is quite useless now, since twitter automatically shortens URLs, even PURLs 16:00  but all the xwiki.org related stuff in this script  should not be used, appart from this all was working well last time 16:01  so are we ok to drop this purl part? 16:01  whatever we can simplify for the release is big plus 16:02  sure if PURL is useless we should remove that part 16:02  +1 to remove PURL, unless we have some other use for it. 16:02  it was also never discussed AFAIR 16:03  is the existance of the PURL a convention that users have began to rely on? If not, drop it 16:03  plus, we also updated the PURL format and no one screamed :) 16:03  a tweet is a tweet 16:03  I'll drop it 16:03  we'll see if someone screams 16:05  hmm the hard part is that I need to modify the script 16:06  ok that's easy actually 16:08  vmassol: I want to start working on the translations page silviar sent. I will take each item and see if the value or translation key is missing. AFAIK now all our translations are in oldcore jar, right ? 16:09  and if you have more guidelines about this, so I won't have to trouble the devs too much 16:09  I'm thinking to modify the jar, and repackage it, reboot the wiki, to make sure the key is t he correct one 16:10  sdumitriu: translations are in oldcore and in wiki pages 16:10  oops 16:10  that's not sdumitriu but sburjan 16:10  ;) 16:11  what I don't know is how to track down a translation if the translation is in a wiki page 16:11  :) 16:11  if you wish to test a key all you need is to create a page 16:11  that's the most hard step for me 16:11  add a translation class to it 16:11  and then add the key in that page's content in the form 16:11  key=value 16:11  sburjan: you can try to search the translation on l10n.xwiki.org 16:11  (in the correct translation languageà 16:11  and you will get the associated key and source 16:12  I want to work on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/TestReports/TranslationsReport43 16:12  sburjan: in http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/L10N/Search to be more precise 16:12  you can search by translation, default message, etc. 16:12  and I have to figure if it's only the value of the key missing, or the whole key 16:12  okay, I'll need to get familiar with it 16:12  with l10n 16:12  you can search the english message you have with that and see if you find a corresponding key 16:13  thanks 16:13  be careful to search only what seems to be static part of the messagecontent 16:13  since in the actual translation dynamic stuff will be things like {0} 16:15  sburjan: another very efficient option is just using grep in xwiki-platform. 16:23  so there shouldn't be any translation in xwiki-enterprise ? I am only looking for the translations that come with the default package 16:24  sburjan: there should not be any translation in XE for new but there will be I guess 16:24  s/new/now/ 16:24  right now the translation for most of them in olcore and some applications also define there own 16:24  XEM also have some 16:25  you can look at l10n.xwiki.org to find all the sources 16:25  in the future each module will host its translations 16:25  yes 16:25  has quit 16:26  has joined #xwiki 16:26  (either in properties file in the module jar or in wiki pages) 16:27  them I musd to this now ! until they won't be scattered across modules :) 16:29  has quit 16:29  too bad username from xwiki.org isn't the same for l10n :( 16:30  yes, we need some LDAP server set up on xwiki.org 16:37  has joined #xwiki 16:40  has quit 16:41  has joined #xwiki 16:50  msmeria: be careful when you document 16:50  to not mix topics and defaults with general rules 16:50  for example on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/Spaces 16:51  the fact that you have "Space Dashboard" is: 16:51  1) only a default in XE 16:51  2) you can have a lot more 16:51  so you shouldn't describe "Space Dashboard" 16:51  which should be described in the module where it's defined 16:51  (ie the dashboard module) 16:52  OTOH you need to link to the notion of Space templates 16:53  I understand. I'll modify the document 16:53  now I don't know where sergiu documented the space template feature 16:53  checking release notes 16:53  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise34#HSimplespacetemplates 16:54  he hasn't documented it :( :( 16:54  I was imagining the key are common on ALL languages, only the value to the key is missing 16:54  (no link to documentation) 16:55  FYI the feature is defined in the dashboard module apparently 16:55  so it needs to be documented there 16:55  you can ping sdumitriu to document it 16:56  sburjan: not sure where you look to say it's not empty 16:56  I have them on http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XWikiCoreResources?action=viewempty&language=fr 16:57  it is empty and it is listed 16:57  odd, because they are not present in ApplicationResources\_fr.properties 16:57  I also have it in http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/L10N/Search?application=&name=&lang=&key=logging.admin.intro&origtext=&transtext= 16:57  sburjan: as you said they are not translation 16:57  empty translation mean empty string in .properties file 16:58  if we put empty stuff in there you will see what you asked for: empty string 16:58  but I don't have the key either in fr translations.
